entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 11 at 5:00AM PDT until August 11 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very Low RH and Gusty Winds in FWZs 284...285...And 624 Thursday and Friday afternoons and evenings... .Gusty south to southwest winds combined with very low RH will lead to critical fire weather conditions Thursday afternoon and evening and, likely, again Friday afternoon and evening across portions of south central Oregon and northeastern California.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 11 at 1:29PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL DUVAL COUNTY IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 12:56PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Flagler, northeastern Nassau, St. Johns, eastern Putnam, east central Clay and eastern Duval Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Callahan to near Lake George. Movement was east at 30 mph.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 11 at 10:28AM ChST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WETTER WEATHER POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A series of passing disturbances could bring periods of heavy rain to the above islands from Monday August 15th to Friday August 19th. Sufficient heavy rain could cause urban and small stream flooding.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 11 at 3:01AM HST until August 11 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR LEEWARD AREAS TODAY... .The combination of dry fuels, strong and gusty trade winds, and low relative humidity will result in critical fire conditions at times today. Any fires that develop could display extreme fire behavior and be difficult to control. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING

entry.cap:areaDesc: Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:27AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left

entry.summary: ...OZONE ACTION DAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the Dallas-Fort Worth area for Thursday, August 11, 2022.
